text: Massimiliano Maddaloni; born in Naples, 22 June 1966) is an Italian manager and former footballer who played predominantly as a Midfielder. He currently serves as an assistant coach for the China national team. ==Career== On March 19, 2019 he received the "Tommaso Maestrelli" career award. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !rowspan="2" width="100"|Club !rowspan="2" |Season !colspan="2" |League !colspan="2" |Cup !colspan="2" |Europe !colspan="2" |Other !colspan="2" |Total |- !width="40"|Apps !width="40"|Goals !width="40"|Apps !width="40"|Goals !width="40"|Apps !width="40"|Goals !width="40"|Apps !width="40"|Goals !width="40"|Apps !width="40"|Goals |- |Napoli |1984-85 |0||0||0||0||–||–||–||–||0||0 |- |Rimini |1985–86 |?||?||5||0||–||–||–||–||5||0 |- |Catania |1987–88 |?||?||5||1||–||–||–||–||5||1 |- |Torres |1989–90 |?||?||1||0||–||–||–||–||1||0 |- |Barletta |1991–92 |?||?||2||0||–||–||–||–||2||0 |- !colspan="2"|Career total !?!!?!!13!!1!!-!!-!!-!!-!!13!!1 |} ==Notes== ==References== ==External links== * *Massimiliano Maddaloni on Soccerway Category:1966 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Rome Category:Italian footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Serie A players Category:Serie C players Category:S.S.C.
